column4: hey i have a program i downloaded called Liquid wars 6 and i have the same problem i have with every program i download wtihout hte add/remove thing. i cant install it. i have the " ./configure      make      make install" command but i dont know how to use them coz nothing happens in terminal
make sure to have the build-essential package installed
sudo apt-get install build-essentialfrom command line
then perhaps i misunderstand your question
just go to synaptic and disable cd from repos
then sudo apt-get update && sudo-apt get install build-essentials
with the cdrom disabled from repolist, it should fetch most recent stable version from internet isntead
what else do you have running?
if you are currently apt-getting something else or running an update, it'll say that
if you are and don't want to stop those processes, you can always just comment out the cdrom repo from your/etc/apt/sources.list file
dont' forget to sudo apt-get update as well
side not, if ./configure produces errors about a package not being found, make sure you have the "-dev(el)" version of that package installed as well
thats my mistake, dunno why i put an s there. installed the package so many times :P
so it says 0 packages to install or that the package can't be found?
then its already installed it woudl seem
you have to install the gmp dev package

essentially. aptitude just remembers dependencies better so that when you uninstall packages you don't have a whole bunch of extra packages left over. supposedly apt-get does this nowadays, but i'm not sure how well
